INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327 Special Evaluation
Section (2) An agency shall inform foster parents of all of the following before
Description they are questioned or interviewed regarding a special evaluation:
(c) That the foster parents may involve a person of their choice in
any interviews with them involving the special evaluation if the
involvement does not impede the timely completion of the evaluation.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Parent was not informed they could have a 3rd party present.
2

Investigation I interviewed Complainant 1 by telephone on 01/03/2023. Complainant
1 stated the foster parents were not allowed to have a third-party
present for the interviews the agency completed with the foster parents
during a special evaluation. Complainant 1 stated they were told that a
lawyer was not needed as a third party because the investigation was
not a criminal issue. Complainant 1 reported in a subsequent email that
on May 5, 2022, Foster Care Supervisor 1 spoke with Foster Father 1
to ask Foster Father 1 about the incident/situation that prompted the
special investigation. Complainant 1 reported that on May 13 Foster
Father 1 spoke with Foster Care Supervisor 1 for 30 minutes regarding
the special investigation and on May 20th he spoke with Foster Care
Supervisor 1 for another 43 minutes and during this time Foster Father
1 asked Foster Care Supervisor 1 if he should have an attorney present
and Foster Care Supervisor 1 told him that would not be necessary as
the special investigation was not a criminal matter. Complainant 1
reported the foster family received the letter from the agency regarding
having a third-party present on 05/24/2022 that was the same day that
the interview occurred with Certification Worker 1 and Certification
Worker 2. Complainant 1 reported they were not given an opportunity to
have a third-party present at that time on 05/24/2022.
I interviewed Administrator 1 at the agency on 01/10/2023.
Administrator 1 provided a copy of the completed special evaluation
related to this investigation. Administrator 1 reported the foster parents
were informed about having a third-party present at the time the
interview took place on 05/24/2022. There was a discussion with me
and Administrator 1 at that time regarding the timeliness of the
notification and rule compliance as well as best practices.
Documentation reviewed:
A copy of the special evaluation report was reviewed. The report
indicated the notification letter was given to the foster parents on
05/24/2022 at the time of the home visit and corresponding interview.
The report also indicated the foster parents declined at that time. There
is also documentation sent with the completed report to the foster
parents that they could have their written response submitted as an
attachment/addendum to the completed report.
Analysis It was confirmed by Complainant 1 and agency staff, as a part of
interviews that were completed as well as the completed special
evaluation report, that the foster parents were provided notification
regarding having a third-party present for the interview that was
completed as a part of the special investigation. There is some concern
that the notification provided was just prior to the interview that was
completed, however it is also noted that the foster parents were aware
of this ability well in advance of the interview based on the foster
4

parents report of the contacts/conversations with agency personnel on
May 5th, 13th, and 20th prior to receiving the formal notification letter
on 05/24/2022. It is also appropriate to note that the third party did not
need to be an attorney as this was not a criminal matter but could be
any other support person. The completed special evaluation report
indicated the foster parents declined having a support person present.
Information received indicated/confirmed the foster parents were given
a copy of the completed special investigation report.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
